topic.title: Logging
topic.p: The simulation has a number of optional logging channels which can report additional information about what is going on in the emulated program. The debugger has commands to manage the logging configuration.
The lfl (log filter list) command displays the list of available logging channels and their current status:
topic.pre: Altirra> lfl 850 off 850 interface SIO activity CAS on Cassette I/O CASDATA off Cassette data CASDRDATA off Cassette direct data CASIMAGE off Cassette image processing CS8900AD off CS8900A network data (requirse CS8900AN channel) CS8900AN on CS8900A network transmit/receive CS8900AR off CS8900A reads CS8900AW on CS8900A writes DISK off Disk activity DISKCMD off Disk commands DISKIMAGE off Disk image load details DISKXFR off Disk data transfer DS1305CR off DS1305 real time clock reads DS1305UR off DS1305 real time clock user reads DS1305W off DS1305 real time clock writes FLASH off Flash memory erase operations FLASHWR off Flash memory write operations FPACCEL off Floating-point acceleration HOOKSIO off OS SIO hook messages HOOKSIOREQS off OS SIO hook requests IDE off IDE activity IDEERROR off IDE interface errors MODEM off Modem activity MODEMDATA off Modem interface data MODEMTCP off Modem TCP/IP activity PCLINK off PCLink activity V3021 off V3021 real time clock accesses VDISK off Virtual disk activity XEPCMD off XEP-80 Commands XEPDATA off XEP-80 Data Transfer
topic.p: Most channels default to off, although a few are enabled by default. The lfe (log filter enable), lfd (log filter disable), and lft (log filter enable tagged) commands are used to modify the state of a channel. For example, enabling the MODEM channel is useful for checking the modem commands being sent out over the R: device:
topic.pre: Altirra> lfe modem Enabled logging channel: MODEM Altirra> g MODEM: Executing command: [Z] MODEM: Sending response: OK
topic.p: There are a couple of other useful logging paths that are not controlled via the logging system:

ul.li: .traceser enables logging of raw serial I/O bus traffic.
